Fun fact: I played Portal 2 before this. Portal 1 levels are definitely much easier and offer less features, compared to Portal 2. However, what really entices me to keep replaying Portal 1 is the mystery that revolves around the self-aware GLaDOS and the graffiti scribbled in various secret areas, namely "the cake is a lie". The story never fails to spark my curiosity for answers and the cliffhanger ending only increases it. Bonus levels are actually challenging and are suited for experienced portal players who seek greater difficulty. ALWAYS, always love the "Still Alive" credits song.
An innovative puzzle game that everyone must try.

Portal is a Pick-up-and-play puzzler that anyone can enjoy, especially nerds

I feel that a nuanced review for Portal at this point is totally redundant. Ultimately in the graph of people playing this game over time I most likely stand outside of the 99th percentile. I don't mind going back and reviewing retro games in detail if they are cultural monuments that benefit from a greater level of dissection, but I don't think Portal needs this.

I played Portal for the first time today, the 27th of June 2021, some fourteen years after its date of release. It holds up perfectly.

Although the actual concept is brilliantly creative, the word that sums up Portal best in my opinion is "elegant." In my 2.8 hours I completed the base game (I have yet to touch the additional maps) despite being a bit rubbish at some of the skill-based controls. In addition to its core concept, Portal has enjoyable puzzles, refuses to waste your time at any moment, and absolutely oozes charm.

Given its brevity and low, low cost, I think Portal is one of very few games that could be considered an essential purchase.

Absolutely recommended.
Great story and great gamplay even for this old of a game. I highly recommend!

Portal is a great game. While being short it provides fun puzzles and a small story that unravels as you progress. It also has some great replay value. Overall a great game, I had a fun time playing it. It's  a must-buy :) [spoiler]The cake is a lie[/spoiler]

EDIT: this is also a really fun game to speedrun
